title: Myrtleford aims for flawless season in AWFA League competition . | The Border Mail
body_text:
Myrtleford Savoy is targeting an unbeaten Albury Wodonga Football Association season in the League after sealing a second successive division one men's title.
Subscribe now for unlimited access.
or signup to continue reading
The home team pipped Albury City 3-2 in Sunday's third-last round.
"We captured the League last week and on the back of closing that out, sometimes you can get complacent thinking about the Cup finals, but the desire to go unbeaten is burning within them," Myrtleford coach Jayden Vescio said.
Myrtleford has 16 wins and two draws, along with two byes, to sit on 56 points. Albury Hotspurs is second on 49.
Albury City is the only team to beat Myrtleford this season, but that was in the FA Cup, which is separate to the League crown.
"They're a really good team, well coached and structured. We controlled 80 per cent of the game (on Sunday), although they had a 10-15 minute period in the second half where they got on top," Vescio said.
"They're very good going forward, they've scored a lot of goals (80), but defensively we were really good. We were disappointed to concede two goals, but they were both from set pieces."
Striker Azia Feltrin scored a double and Tom Morrison snared the other.
"Azia was really good, while Tommy Morrison was super out wide," Vescio said.
City's Noah Sredojevic was terrific in attack, while Paris Maw and David Samiec had a strong battle with Myrtleford's Josh Zito and Scott Peggie in the midfield.
Elsewhere, Albury United defeated St Pats FC 2-0, while Melrose FC pipped Wodonga Diamonds 2-1.
Meanwhile, the division one women's league title is likely to be decided in the final round.
On Sunday, Boomers FC toppled Wodonga Heart 5-0. Brianna Kusic nabbed a double, while Alarna Parascos, Ashleigh Barr and Claire Mahoney grabbed a goal each.
Melrose FC claimed a 3-1 win over Wodonga Diamonds.
Albury Hotspurs had the bye and lead the competition on 55 points from Boomers (54) and Melrose (52).
'Spurs have a goal differential of 74, Boomers 65 and Melrose 50.
Boomers host Myrtleford Savoy in the penultimate round, while 'Spurs and Melrose have byes.
In round 22, Melrose is away to Myrtleford, Boomers host Diamonds, while 'Spurs travel to Wangaratta City.
